data.title: Connoisseur Media Announces The New AME Studios
data.meta_description: Farmingdale, NY, September 7, 2018 â Connoisseur Media Long Island is proud to announce the new AME Studio at their Farmingdale offices...
data.text:
Farmingdale, NY, September 7, 2018 â Connoisseur Media Long Island is proud to announce the new AME Studio at their Farmingdale offices. Â As the name implies, the studio will be home to AMEâs weekly show: Suffolk Matters. Â The show, hosted by The Suffolk County Association of Municipal Employeesâ President Dan Levler, discusses the news and views you wonât hear anywhere else and where Suffolk County meets the men and women of Suffolk County AME.

âWe are thrilled to broadcast Suffolk Matters from our brand new state of the art studio at WALK 97.5,â said Suffolk AME President Daniel C. Levler.â Our weekly talk show expands AMEâs ongoing public engagement with Suffolk County residents, labor and community leaders and elected officials as part of our efforts to showcase the unique contributions of the men and women who make this County work every day. We are proud of our partnership with our friends at WALK 97.5 and deeply appreciate their continued support of our program and our mission.â

Connoisseur Media Long Island Director of Operations Patrick Shea stated, âSuffolk County AME has been a great partner for the radio station. Â Itâs remarkable to find a show that speaks to issues important to the community. Â Weâre happy to be able to provide a platform for Suffolk County AME to speak to all their members at once and introduce Suffolk County's largest independent union to the rest of the Long Island. â

You can listen to Suffolk Matters LIVE from the AME Studios Sunday mornings at 7:30AM on WALK 97.5.

About Connoisseur Media Long Island

We are Connoisseur Media, a broadcast media company that delivers quality radio to listeners, advertisers and communities. Â Connoisseur is recognized as one of the top 20 radio broadcasters in the United States. Â In the Nassau-Suffolk area, we deliver top personalities, music, news, and information via our local brands like 94.3 WWSK-FM, 98.3 WKJY-FM, 103.1 WBZO-FM, 1100 WHLI-AM, 1370 WALK-AM, and 97.5 WALK-FM. Â We believe that people are the passion and heart of our Company.

ABOUT SUFFOLK AME

With over 6,000 active and over 4,000 retired Suffolk County Workers, The Suffolk County Association of Municipal Employees (AME) is the largest independent union in the State of New York. AME represents a large majority of Suffolk County Government workers in areas such as the Child Support Enforcement Bureau, Consumer Affairs, Civil Service, Crossing Guards, District Attorney, Finance & Technology, Family Services, Fire Rescue Emergency Services, Health Services, Labor Dept, Medicaid, Medical Examiners, Parks Dept, Patient Care, Police Civilian, Police Emergency, Public Works, Sheriff/Probation Civilians, Social Services, Suffolk County Community College, Vector Control and more.
